alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 7:44PM MST until January 06 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...Until Noon MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light snow will develop across north-central Montana tonight and may mix with freezing rain or drizzle at times late tonight through early Friday morning. While snow accumulations will be light and generally less than one inch, the potential for freezing rain or drizzle could make some road surfaces particularly icy Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
